cyclone.name: MINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles WSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the northeast Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle tonight, then forecast to cross southern Georgia/South Carolina and move offshore into the western Atlantic within 24-36 h
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle between Mexico Beach and Steinhatchee River (near Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL (Tropical Storm Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL (Tropical Storm Warning in effect)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle coast tonight, then coastal Georgia and South Carolina Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–30 mph possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor, generally less than 2 ft above normal tides along Tampa Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Passing squalls may drop 1–3 inches of rain through early Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low chance of an isolated tornado in outer rain bands
